intro: Hieracium hittense, commonly known as Hittite hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium hittense is known for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments.
